sentence: Colgate-Palmolive Company ( CL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on July 16, 2014.
A cash dividend payment of $0.36 per share is scheduled to be paid on August 15, 2014.
Shareholders who purchased CL stock prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 5.88% increase over the same period a year ago.
At the current stock price of $69.79, the dividend yield is 2.06%.
The previous trading day's last sale of CL was $69.79, representing a -0.46% decrease from the 52 week high of $70.11 and a 22.57% increase over the 52 week low of $56.94.
CL is a part of the Consumer Non-Durables sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
CL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $2.32.
Zacks Investment Research reports CL's forecasted earnings growth in 2014 as 5.08%, compared to an industry average of 4%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the CL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
